settings.title: CodePacks - Mad Libs
settings.description: Build a digitized mad libs word game using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to enhance your understanding of vocabulary and grammar. Practice using a wide range of vocabulary and express and develop ideas with increasing accuracy.

content.instructions: Mad Libs is a popular word game where a a player is prompted for a list of words. Each word is then used to fill in the blanks of a story where certain words have been removed - but the player is not told what the story is! The list of words that the player provides is then inserted into the blanks, and the story is finally read aloud - often with hilarious results! In this project, we will learn how to build our very own Mad Libs game using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

content.instructions:
Now we can buid our Mad Libs story! 

Remember, Mad Libs works by creating a story with certain words removed. 

To do that, we will use JavaScript variables to store the player's list of words. 

Your story must contain these keywords written exactly as listed below: 

  • (color)

  • (superlative)

  • (body_parts)

  • (body_part)

  • (noun)

  • (animal)

  • (adjective1)

  • (adjective2)

  • (adjective3)

  • (adjective4)

Example: The (color) Dragon is the (superlative) Dragon of all. It has (adjective1) (body_parts), and a (body_part) shaped like a (noun)...

Showcase your vocabulary skills by writing your story - be creative! 

Required Syntax:

  • variable

  • string
